text: The Melaka Butterfly and Reptile Sanctuary () is a butterfly house in Ayer Keroh, Melaka, Malaysia. ==History== The sanctuary was opened on 1 February 1999 and officiated by Melaka Chief Minister Mohd Ali Rustam. ==Architecture== The sanctuary was built over an area of 4.8 hectares with a build-up area of 1.6 hectares.http://ww1.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2011&dt;=0621&pub;=Utusan_Malaysia&sec;=Selatan&pg;=ws_01.htm The sanctuary has four sections, which are Larva Center, Pupa House, Tarantula Adventure and Bugs Kingdom. ==Exhibition== The sanctuary exhibits over more than 20 species of butterfly. ==Facilities== The sanctuary is equipped with toilet, cafeteria, souvenir shops and resting area.http://ww1.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2009&dt;=0929&pub;=utusan_malaysia&sec;=selatan&pg;=ws_01.htm ==Research and development== In February 2017, the sanctuary produced an artificial nectar to replace flower nectar to prolong the lifespan of butterflies until 28 days. ==Opening time== The park opens everyday from 8.30 a.m. to 5.30 a.m. ==See also== * List of tourist attractions in Melaka * List of butterfly houses ==References== ==External links== * Category:1991 establishments in Malaysia Category:Tourist attractions in Malacca Category:Zoos established in 1991 Category:Zoos in Malaysia Category:Buildings and structures in Malacca
